title.narrative: Feasibility Study: Somaliland cultural/heritage tourism sector

description.narrative:
The unrecognised Republic of Somaliland is the most politically stable, but still poverty-ridden, region of Somalia. Somaliland is over-dependent on livestock trade and urgently needs to diversify its economy in order to generate sustainable income and employment for its vulnerable communities. The exceptional potential of the cultural and natural heritage of Somaliland is still largely untapped. This is due to partly inaccurate information on security concerns deriving from the wider Somali context, to weak policies and institutions, as well as to insufficient skills, infrastructure and investment in its tourism sector.
The Project will carry out a feasibility study of the tourism market potential for Somaliland’s cultural and natural heritage. The research will address both regional and international tourist routes and market segments, and its outcomes will also be used for enhancing Somaliland’s image and international perception. Consultation and planning will involve all key stakeholders from government, development agencies, tourism-related organisations and local communities around archaeological and natural sites.
As a result, Somaliland’s local authorities and communities will have access to comprehensive and updated information on the most viable business models for the development of community-led heritage-based tourism, which will enable them to generate visitor interest, mobilise relevant investment and stimulate local enterprises.
